meanings.definition: A feeling of light-headedness or dizziness.
meanings.sent1: The giddiness she felt after spinning around quickly made her sit down.
meanings.sent2: His giddiness was due to the roller coaster ride that spun him around.
meanings.sent3: The giddiness from the merry-go-round ride made her giggle uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The giddiness of the spinning world around her felt like a dizzying dance.
meanings.sent5: The giddiness of the spinning top mesmerized the children at play.

meanings.definition: A state of being frivolous or flighty.
meanings.sent1: Her giddiness at the party made her forget all her worries.
meanings.sent2: The giddiness of her laughter filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent3: His giddiness about the new toy was infectious, making everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The giddiness of the puppy's playful antics brought laughter to the family.
meanings.sent5: The giddiness of the children playing in the park was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: A sense of excitement or exhilaration.
meanings.sent1: The giddiness of winning the race was overwhelming.
meanings.sent2: Her giddiness before the concert was palpable.
meanings.sent3: The giddiness of the surprise party left her speechless.
meanings.sent4: The giddiness of the crowd at the festival was contagious.
meanings.sent5: The giddiness of the first snowfall brought smiles to everyone's faces.
